column4: Frisco PD is committed to raising awareness about teen dating violence, protecting the victims, and ending dating abuse. Everyone has a part, even if that one thing seems small in the moment. What #1Thing will you do? For more info, visit http://www.loveisrespect.org. #TDVAM2020

Tell burglars to go fly a kite by doing the #9PMRoutine tonight and every night. Remove the valuables and guns from your car and lock it up. Then close your garage and turn on your outside lights! Your Community, Your Commitment #YC2 #NationalKiteFlyingDay
Circumstances like this need to be reported using our non-emergency number. Our social media is not monitored 24/7 and should not be used to summon a police response.
Our Fightin’ Frisco High School Raccoons appreciate it!
With tax season upon us, scammers will be calling and using other methods to steal your identity. Arm yourself with the tools and info that can stop them!

The #9PMRoutine is one of the basic elements in crime prevention. So don't be inert, remove the valuables and guns from your car and lock it up. Then close your garage and turn on your outside lights! Your Community, Your Commitment #YC2 #PeriodicTableDay
SHARE - The subjects pictured are suspected of theft at Sprint. If you recognize either person or have additional information, please message us here or call 972-292-6200. Reference report #19130897.

TRAFFIC UPDATE - 02.07.2020 @1319 The intersection of southbound 121 and Hillcrest has reopened. Thanks for your understanding and patience, which helps ensure the safety of the police and fire units at the scene.
TRAFFIC ALERT - 02.07.2020 @1233 The intersection of southbound 121 and Hillcrest is currently shut down due to a crash. Please avoid the area and find an alternate route.

Sending prayers to our Blue families in Alabama and Florida. Ofc. Nick O'Rear (Kimberly Police Dept.) was shot and killed during a pursuit, and Trp. Joseph Bullock (Florida Highway Patrol) was shot and killed on a motorist assist. These heroes will never be forgotten. @FLHSMV

Diversity has played an integral role in the growth and success of our nation, our state, and our community. During #BlackHistoryMonth, we celebrate important pioneers who have figured prominently in our past and whose legacy continues to influence our present.

The only "Blizzard" you can count on in Texas. Don't forget to count on your #9PMROUTINE! Get the guns and valuables out of your car, lock it up. Then close your garage and turn on your outside lights. Your Community, Your Commitment #YC2 #BLIZZARDFAIL2020

Interested in learning more about your Frisco Police Department? Do you live, work, or study in Frisco? Are you 18 or older? Then join us for the Spring session of the FPD Citizens Police Academy. Registration now open!!! For more info, visit http://www.friscotexas.gov/cpa
Here comes the sun, doo-dun doo-doo / Here comes the sun... Buckle (and bundle) up, slow down, and be patient with one another. Make it a great day Frisco!

Texas weather keeps meteorologists on their toes, and we appreciate their hard work and dedication! Keep burglars on their toes with the #9PMRoutine. Remove guns and valuables from your car, lock it up, close your garage, then turn on your outside lights. #YC2 #WeatherpersonsDay
SHARE - The subject pictured is suspected of theft at Target. If you recognize this person or have additional information, please message us here or call 972-292-6200. Reference report #19121120.

Come rain, snow, sleet, or hail, thank a mail carrier for braving the elements to always deliver. The #9PMRoutine delivers too: get the guns and valuables out of your car, lock it up, close your garage, and turn on your outside lights. #YC2 #ThankAMailCarrierDay

Interested in learning more about your Frisco Police Department? Do you live, work, or study in Frisco? Are you 18 or older? Then join us for the Spring session of the FPD Citizens Police Academy. Registration begins on February 6th! For more info, visit http://www.friscotexas.gov/cpa

We are saddened to learn of the passing of Liberty County SO Deputy Richard Whitten. His heroic actions in 2019 led to his making the ultimate sacrifice yesterday. Our thoughts and prayers are with his family, both blood and Blue, during this incredibly difficult time.

The #9PMRoutine is more than a Frisco thing. Check out our friends @Corinth_Police and give them a follow! Then get the guns and valuables out of your car, lock it up, close your garage, and turn on your outside lights!
Follow our friends @NWSFortWorth for the most up-to-date info and stay weather aware!

The groundhog may not be able to predict Texas weather, but we are 100% certain about the effectiveness of the #9PMRoutine. Get the guns and valuables out of your car and lock it. Then close your garage and turn on your outside lights! Your Community, Your Commitment #YC2
We are rooting for the sober drivers!

If you've had too much to drink and get behind the wheel, be prepared to celebrate the big game with us in our jail. Our officers will be out tonight looking for you and other intoxicated drivers. #RealFansMakeAPlan Spot a possible DWI? Don't hesitate, call us! 972.292.6010

The #9PMRoutine reminder will be absent of the amazing (yet awful) humor our followers are used to. That doesn’t excuse you from removing the valuables/guns from your car, locking it up, closing your garage, and turning on your outside lights. Your Community, Your Commitment #YC2

Our thoughts and prayers are with Chief Markle and our Blue family with @CorpusChristiPD. Officer Alan McCollum was struck and killed last night during a traffic stop. The driver has been charged with intoxication manslaughter. Rest easy Brother and thank you for your service.
For #SuperBowlLIV, the keys to success won't be found in the hands of a drunk driver. Make a plan...designate a driver...arrive alive. #RealFansMakeAPlan #DriveSober #ArriveAlive
The nutritional equivalent of a doughnut.

This morning, members of the PD and our families gathered for frigid fellowship as we cleaned up our adopted street. Hot coffee and power rings helped take our minds off of the cold...mostly. Ok, not really, but we enjoyed spending time together for a good cause!

Friendly reminder...if you operate an alarm (monitored or not) at your home or business in Frisco, with the intent to summon an emergency service of the city, an alarm permit is required. That permit must be renewed annually. For more info, visit: http://www.friscotexas.gov/alarmpermits

The #9PMRoutine requires far less thought than Kierkegaard's quote requires. Remove the guns and valuables from your car and lock it up. Then close your garage and turn on your outside lights. Your Community, Your Commitment #YC2 #NationalBackwardDay
Awesome!
Chief, a heartfelt thanks to you and your PD for sharing this amazing story. Talk about a family that has service in their blood!
Only a K9 officer would do this...

Kwah-sahn : cruh-sahnt : cre-sint. There might be more than one way to say croissant, but your job right now has only one name: #9PMRoutine. Remove the guns and valuables from your car, lock it up, close your garage, then turn on your outside lights. #YC2 #NationalCroissantDay
We haven’t set a date yet, but a second session will certainly be planned in the not too distant future.
Great turnout for our first Active Threat Response training! Thank you to everyone that came out tonight. The incredible partnership we have with our residents makes Frisco a safer place.

Yesterday afternoon, we celebrated the career of Sergeant Bryan Sartain, who retired after serving the @CityOfFriscoTx for nearly 23 years. Thank you, Sarge, for your dedication to our department and our residents. Good luck in your future endeavors!

Celebrating the big game isn't complete without chips and queso. Your night shouldn't be complete without doing the #9PMRoutine. Remove the guns and valuables from your car and lock it. Then close your garage and turn on your outside lights! #YC2 #NationalCornChipDay
SHARE - The subjects pictured are suspected of theft at Walmart. If you recognize any of them or have additional information, please message us here or call 972-292-6200. Reference report #19135745.

January is National Stalking Awareness Month. Frisco PD is committed to raising awareness of this crime, preventing it, and providing resources to victims. Stalking...Know It, Name It, Stop It. For more info, visit: http://www.stalkingawareness.org #NSAM2020

Today, we honor the life of Joe Murphy, the first Frisco PD officer killed in the line of duty. On this day in 1968, Ofc. Murphy lost his life in a crash on Preston Rd. while responding to assist officers in Celina. Thank you for your service sir, you will never be forgotten.

To complete a puzzle, every piece is required. To fight crime, every Frisco resident is needed...start with the #9PMRoutine. Get the guns and valuables out of your car and lock it. Then close your garage and turn on your outside lights! Your Community, Your Commitment #YC2

Interested in a career as a police officer or dispatcher? Stop by and visit with our recruiters at the Collin College (Spring Creek) Conference Center. We will be there until 2! Answer the call...join our team.
Give yourself some extra time this morning to get to work or drop off the kids at school, and be patient with those around you. Slow down...you’ll get there.

#TrafficTipTuesday - When at an intersection, vehicles are required to stop behind the stop line (when present). Stopping in a crosswalk is not only illegal, but creates a hazard for pedestrians. Obeying traffic laws is one part of Your Commitment to Your Community! #YC2
Absolutely!
Thanks for your kind words!
Nice!

Since several have asked, bubble wrap is NOT a burglary deterrent. Pop into the #9PMRoutine and find out what crime prevention is all about. Remove the guns and valuables from your car and lock it, then close your garage and turn on your outside lights! #YC2 #BubbleWrapDay

Thinking of our Brothers and Sisters tonight with the Virginia Peninsula Regional Jail. Major Angelanette Moore, a 20 year veteran, passed away of a heart attack while on duty. Thank you for your service ma’am.

DYK - In partnership with Project ChildSafe, Frisco PD has free Firearm Safety Kits available. Each kit includes a gun lock and safety education brochure and can be picked up from the desk officer located inside our PD lobby. Find more info at http://www.projectchildsafe.org.

Unless you want your spouse to max out the "I Told You So" meter, complete the #9PMRoutine. Remove the valuables and firearms from your car and lock it up. Then close your garage and turn on your outside lights. Your Community, Your Commitment #YC2 #NationalSpousesDay

Lack the motivation to do the #9PMRoutine? Maybe Major Payne can get you squared away...REMOVE the valuables and firearms from your car, LOCK it down, CLOSE your garage, then TURN ON your outside lights! *Push ups are not optional* Your Community, Your Commitment #YC2

There's an app for that! Download the Frisco PD mobile app for convenient access to important information and services. Submit a tip, learn about programs offered by FPD, find your child's School Resource Officer contact information, and more!

Our followers do a FANTASTIC job of sharing the #9PMRoutine! Thank you for telling others to remove the valuables and firearms from their cars and locking up, then closing their garages and turning on their lights! Your Community, Your Commitment #YC2 #NationalComplimentDay
This afternoon, we held a ceremony to recognize the following promotions: Cpl. S. Byrom was promoted to Sergeant Ofc. C. Smith was promoted to Sergeant Please join us in congratulating them!

Sending our deepest condolences to our Brothers and Sisters in Blue with @NewportNewsPD. Officer Katie Thyne died yesterday after being dragged by a car during a narcotics investigation. Rest easy Sister, we've got the watch from here.

Don't end up with pie on your face tomorrow, do the #9PMRoutine tonight! Get the guns and valuables out of your car and lock it up. Then make sure your garage is closed and turn on your outside lights! Your Community, Your Commitment #YC2 #NationalPieDay

Early this morning, Deputy Sheldon Whiteman of the Long County (GA) Sheriff’s Office was killed in a crash. His passing marks the 24,000th line of duty death in history. Our thoughts and prayers are with his family, both blood and Blue, during this difficult time.
Thank you for all that you do for us!

DYK - There is a service that allows users to report issues in Frisco related to lighting, parks, traffic signals, and more! To create a service request, download the myFrisco app or visit https://friscotx.citysourced.com/default.aspx It takes everyone doing their part to keep our city great!
The subject in our post from yesterday has been identified. Thank you to everyone that passed along information!

As if you needed any more convincing, the #9PMRoutine is clearly the way to preventing crime. Remove the guns and valuables from your car and lock it up. Then close your garage and turn on your outside lights! How can one be a victim if they choose this way of life? #YC2

Good morning Frisco! Slow down on the wet roads, give yourself a little extra time to get to work, and be patient with other motorists. Make it a great day!

On this #SquirrelAppreciationDay, show some love for your favorite nut loving critter by doing the #9PMRoutine. Get the valuables and guns out of your car and lock it up. Then make sure your garage is closed and turn on your outside lights. Your Community, Your Commitment #YC2
Thank you both for your dedicated service to our city!

DID YOU KNOW? The Frisco Police Department's Traffic Division is responsible for Commercial Motor Vehicle Enforcement. These officers work diligently to ensure that unsafe commercial vehicles are removed from our roads, and enforcement action is taken against the operators.

At certain locations, traffic may be directed counter to what the diagram specifies, allowed under subsection (e) of TxTC 545.101. Our post was intended to address the larger majority of turns made. Sorry for any confusion.

#TrafficTipTuesday - To make a left turn, make the approach in the left-hand lane and turn left so as to arrive in a lane lawfully available. To make a right turn, make both the approach and the turn as closely as practicable to the right-hand curb or edge of the roadway.

Venus: You never went to college. Johnny: Hey man, I went through Princeton! Venus: I'll bet. Johnny: I did. It was in a car. A squad car, actually. Very, very educational. This walk down memory lane brought to you by the #9PMRoutine. Locks and lights! #NationalDiscJockeyDay

Two more heroes killed, two more members of our Blue family gone too soon. Sending our thoughts and prayers to the men and women of the @honolulupolice after the loss of Officers Kaulike Kalama and Tiffany Enriquez. Mai poina 'ole.

Dr. King issued this challenge over 60 years ago, and it is incumbent upon us to heed his message. Make part of your life's work brightening the life of another, and do it well. Be it through a smile or random act of kindness, you can make a difference. Thank you, Dr. King.

Get your popcorn ready, but don't dive into it until you've done the #9PMRoutine. Remove the valuables and guns from your car and lock it up, then close your garage and turn on your outside lights for added security! Your Community, Your Commitment #YC2 #NationalPopcornDay
Congratulations! Your hard work and team effort paid off! #TitanNation #StrongerTogether

Friends don't let friends go to bed without first reminding them to do the #9PMRoutine. Remove the hunny pot from your car, lock the doors, close your garage, then turn on your outside lights for added security. Your Community, Your Commitment #YC2 #NationalWinnieThePoohDay
Yeah baby!
Thank you!!

Going away on vacation? Take advantage of the Frisco Police Department's House Watch Program. It's designed for residents who will NOT have anyone at their home while they are away for an extended period of time (house/pet sitters, etc.).

Even these bad boys know a good thing when they see it. Do the #9PMRoutine and get the guns and valuables out of your car and lock it up. Then close your garage and turn on your outside lights! Good men, good men...whatcha gonna do? Fight crime every night.
Today, we honor the memory of @LittleElmTX Police Department Det. Jerry Walker...our Brother and our Friend. You will never be forgotten.

You know what time it is...and you know what to do. Get the guns and valuables out of your car and lock it up. Then make sure your garage door is closed and turn on your outside lights for added security! Your Community, Your Commitment #YC2 #9PMRoutine

Use your wipers to see out your windshield, and keep your headlights on to be seen by other motorists. Drive to the conditions and drive friendly Frisco!

Part of what calls us to law enforcement is helping others and running towards an emergency, not away from it. Our thoughts and prayers are with @LASDHQ and Bryan County (OK) Sheriff's Office, both of which lost deputies this week doing exactly that. Rest easy Sister and Brother.

We've brought in an officer for the #9PMRoutine, and he's serious about his work. Before we send him out to "squeak and destroy" those who haven't complied, remove the guns and valuables from your car and lock it. Then close your garage and and turn on your outside lights! #YC2
Congratulations!

Are you a soldier that will be separating soon? Are you looking to continue your career with a progressive law enforcement agency focused on exceptional service? Visit with our recruiters today from 10a to 3p at the @forthood Mega Career Fair. Answer the Call...Join our Team.

#TrafficTipTuesday - Headlight out? Driving with high beams on is NOT the answer. 2 low beam headlights are required, illuminating at least 150 ft ahead. You MUST dim your high beams within 500 ft of an oncoming vehicle or within 300 ft when approaching a vehicle from the rear.
Great!

Ernie reminds everyone to help prevent crime by doing the #9PMRoutine tonight. Remove the valuables and guns from your car and lock it up. Then close your garage and turn on your outside lights! Brought to you by the number 9 and the letters P and M. #YC2 #NationalRubberDuckyDay
Awesome!!
Going out tonight to enjoy the big game? Don’t make a big mistake afterwards by getting behind the wheel intoxicated. Make a plan, drive sober.

It's time for the #9PMRoutine, and time to bring your guns and valuables inside and lock your car. Then close your garage and turn on your outside lights! Far be it from us to state the obvious, but these things won't happen on their own. Your Community, Your Commitment #YC2
This was NOT an active shooter situation. Officers did respond to a weapons offense and were able to detain a suspect. No injuries reported.

Our #9PMRoutine tonight is going to include a shout out to @NDSUfootball and @JMUFootball. Thanks to these 2 teams for playing an incredible game, and to the fans for embodying the spirit that makes college football great. Congrats to the Bison on the win and see y’all next year!
Please keep Firefighter Matt Dawson, who is in critical condition, in your thoughts and prayers as well.

Our hearts go out to @LubbockPolice and @LubbockFire after the loss of Ofc. Nicholas Reyna and Lt. Eric Hill. Both died after being struck while working a crash scene this morning. Be it Finest or Bravest, our public safety family finds strength in each other during these times.

DON'T BE A VICTIM! Our officers regularly field calls about scam artists purporting to be from the Social Security Admin, etc. Please follow these tips, and if you ever have any doubt about who you are talking to, find the organization's main number and call them directly.

DANGER...failure to do the #9PMRoutine could leave you in for a real shock the next morning! Remove the guns and valuables from your car and lock it up. Then make sure your garage is closed and turn on your outside lights! Your Community, Your Commitment #YC2

***THIS CLASS IS FULL*** There are no more seats available in the venue. Based on the massive response from the public, we will be hosting another Active Threat Response in the coming months. Continue watching our social media for dates and free tickets.
Lifting up in prayer our Brothers and Sisters with @LakelandPD, who lost Officer Paul Dunn yesterday in a crash. Your Blue family in Texas supports you. @ODMP
Great advice from our friends @NWSFortWorth. If you haven't already, make a plan now to receive alerts and stay weather aware!

Don't be static...complete the #9PMRoutine and shock the criminals! Remove the valuables and firearms from your car and lock it up, then close your garage door and turn on your outside lights. Your Community, Your Commitment #YC2 #StaticElectricityDay
Thank you to the players from both schools for spending time with these young athletes! Good luck in the championship!

Thank you!

Today, we extend our sincerest appreciation to all law enforcement, past and present, who have answered the call to serve their communities. Thank you for your dedication! #Respect #LawEnforcementAppreciationDay
Thanks for calling us to report it. Officers had already checked the location and ensured that it was secure. Unfortunately, it took longer than expected for the business to reset the alarm.
Thank you!!
Frisco PD said to the entire city, It’s time for the #9PMRoutine. We sure would be delighted with your company, Come on and prevent crime with us and The King... Let's Rock! #YC2 #ElvisBirthday

Officer Rotello would like to remind everyone that it's time for the #9PMRoutine. Remove the guns and valuables from your car and lock it up! Then make sure your garage is closed and turn on your outside lights! Your Community, Your Commitment #YC2 #NationalBobbleheadDay
Thank you for your dedicated service to our city, Chief Brinton!

Though the new year is only a week old, our nation has already lost two of its Finest. @nyspolice Inv. Ryan Fortini passed away from cancer related to 9/11 and Florence (SC) Regional Airport DPS PSO Jackson Winkeler was shot and killed during a traffic stop. #NeverForget @ODMP
The first day back to school can be a little rough, so we thought we’d pass along this gentle reminder. Slow down in school zones...20 means 20. The safety of our students depends on it!
The #9PMRoutine is more than a Frisco thing. After completing your nightly crime prevention, check out our friends @PascoSheriff. They are the folks that got this whole thing started!

Don't stick your head in the sand when it comes to stopping crime. Frisco is Your Community, requiring Your Commitment. Complete the #9PMRoutine...don't leave valuables or firearms in your car and lock it. Then close your garage and turn on those lights! #YC2 #NationalBirdDay
Good morning Frisco! The weather looks to be beautiful today. Be patient, show one another kindness, and make it a great day!

The #9PMRoutine is easier than a four-year old trying to pronounce pasgetti...um, spaghetti. Pull the valuables and guns out of your car, make sure the doors get locked, close your garage, then light up your driveway. Your Community, Your Commitment #YC2 #NationalSpaghettiDay

Involved in a crash and need a copy of the report? Vehicle crash reports (completed by Frisco PD officers) can be obtained in person, by mail, or online for a nominal fee. They are available 5-7 business days after the incident. For more info, visit:

Impossible to resist, he is...heed his advice to prevent crime, you should. Remove the valuables and guns out of your car and lock it. Then close your garage and turn on your outside lights. Your Community, Your Commitment #YC2 #9PMRoutine

Winning the war against crime isn't a work of science fiction. The #9PMRoutine is a great defense against burglars. Don't leave valuables or guns in your car, lock it up, close your garage, and turn on your lights. Your Community, Your Commitment #YC2 #ScienceFictionDay

For this new year, resolve to do the #9PMRoutine every night. That means making sure not to leave any valuables or guns in your car and locking it up. Then ensure that your garage door is closed and turn on your outside lights! Your Community, Your Commitment #YC2 #HappyNewYear
Happy New Year!! May 2020 be safe and prosperous for you!

#MakeUpYourMindDay...say NO to being a victim and YES to the #9PMRoutine and a happier new year! Remove the valuables and guns from your car and lock it up, then close your garage and turn on your outside lights. It could go down as the best decision you've ever made! #YC2
To all of the First Responders on shift tonight...be safe! #EveryoneGoesHome
One of the toughest parts of our job...

Celebrate the New Year with your family and not in a jail cell (or worse). As part of a multi-agency task force, Frisco PD will have extra officers out tonight, focusing on areas known for a significant number of intoxicated drivers. Believe a driver to be intoxicated? Call us.

Early this morning, Panola County SO Dep. Chris Dickerson was shot and killed during a traffic stop. This month alone, 6 members of our Blue family have been killed in Texas. We send our prayers and support to Sheriff Kevin Lake and all of those touched by this senseless murder.
REMINDER - The administrative offices of the Frisco Police Department will be closed on New Year's Day.

Decisions, decisions, decisions. Just don't be indecisive about doing the #9PMRoutine. Remove the guns and valuables from your car and lock it up. Then close your garage and turn on your outside lights! Your Community, Your Commitment #YC2 #BaconDay
@FriscoCoPD

The holidays can be especially difficult for some. Uplift those who need it and offer to listen to their struggle. If you need assistance, call us or The Lifeline. Life-saving help is only a phone call away.

It's #TickTockDay and time to take care of any unfinished business from 2019. That means starting the #9PMRoutine instead of putting it off until tomorrow...or the next day. Get the guns and valuables out of your car and lock it. Then close your garage and turn on your lights!

Joining our voice with others in praying for those affected by today’s senseless shooting in White Settlement. The response of those at the scene, in both word and deed, shows that hate will never prevail in this world.

DWI affects more than just you. Frisco PD will be participating in a multi-agency DWI Task Force from Dec 23 through Jan 1. During this No Refusal period, extra officers will be on duty during peak times, focusing on areas known for a significant number of intoxicated drivers.
If the land is governed by the county and not Frisco, then the city ordinance is not applicable.
FRIENDLY REMINDER - The possession or discharge of fireworks within the city limits of Frisco is prohibited and carries a fine of up to $2000.00. Celebrate the new year safely (and legally)!

Not many hands can beat four of a kind, but there's one surefire way to keep your valuables out of the hands of a burglar--the #9PMRoutine. After getting them out of your car and locking it up, make sure your garage is closed and turn on your outside lights! #YC2 #CardPlayingDay

Unless the boat being actively loaded/unloaded, parking it on the street in prohibited by city ordinance. Please call our non-emergency number (972.292.6010) so that we can get more information and have an officer respond to address this.

Get informed! The crime mapping dashboard provides users with an interactive experience that displays crimes and crime trends throughout the city. It is available for both desktop and mobile access. For more information, visit:

What’s easier than finding a home for a fruitcake, a.k.a. theft deterrent device? Completing the #9PMRoutine. Remove the guns and valuables from your car and lock it. Then close your garage and turn on your outside lights. #YC2 #NationalFruitcakeDay

Reference a suspicious package reported earlier this evening in the 400-blk of Main. Thanks to @PlanoPoliceDept, @LittleElmTX PD, @DentonCoSheriff, and @McKinneyPolice for their assistance during the investigation.
TRAFFIC UPDATE - 12.27.2019 @7:32p Main Street, between 423 and Prestwick, has reopened. Thanks for your patience.
TRAFFIC ALERT - 12.27.2019 @5:17p Main Street, between 423 and Prestwick, is shutdown while units conduct an investigation. Please seek an alternate route and avoid the area for the time being.
TRAFFIC ALERT - 12.27.2019 @5:02p Eastbound Main St., just east of FM 423, is shutdown while units conduct an investigation. Please avoid the area for the time being.

Buzzed driving is drunk driving. Frisco PD will be participating in a multi-agency DWI Task Force from Dec 23 through Jan 1. During this No Refusal period, extra officers will be on duty during peak times, focusing on areas known for a significant number of intoxicated drivers.
Please call our non-emergency number (972.292.6010) and speak with a supervisor about your concerns.

On trash day, don't set out empty boxes for TVs and other expensive electronics. Break them down and place inside the recycle bin. Otherwise, you might as well have a big neon sign inviting burglars to your home. Stay crime prevention conscious today and every day!

To all of our #9PMRoutine followers, please accept our sincerest thanks. Your willingness to embrace crime prevention, and put up with our dad jokes, is very much appreciated! You embody what it means to be committed to your community! Thank You! #YC2 #NationalThankYouNoteDay

No matter if your holiday travels take you near or far, putting the phone down is one way to ensure you'll get there safely. Ask a passenger to assist you, pull over...whatever it takes! **Our thanks to this Frisco resident for making this tweet possible.
Slow down and don’t use your high beams. Be safe wherever you’re headed this morning!

Our Patrol officers would like to wish you a Merry Christmas one last time and remind you to do the #9PMRoutine. Your newly received gifts shouldn't end up in the hands of a burglar. Get them out of your car and lock it, then close your garage and turn on your outside lights.

DWI doesn't just mean booze. Frisco PD will be participating in a multi-agency DWI Task Force from Dec 23 through Jan 1. During this No Refusal period, extra officers will be on duty during peak times, focusing on areas known for a significant number of intoxicated drivers.

Thank you to @FeedaHero and ALL who have come by the PD and dropped off food. Your support means everything, especially on holidays spent apart from our families. Our Dispatchers, Detention and Patrol personnel appreciate you!
Merry Christmas!
Thank you and Merry Christmas!
Thank you Chief, and a Merry Christmas to y’all!
Merry Christmas from all of us at the Frisco Police Department! Wishing you and yours a safe and happy holiday season. To those serving at home and abroad today...thank you!

Whether you are winding down for a winter's nap or just beginning to wrap presents, don't forget to complete the #9PMRoutine. Burglars don't take the night off just because it's Christmas Eve. If nothing else, our attempt at poetry should drive you to do it!
Many thanks to @IANT_TX for providing a Christmas Eve meal to those on shift today. We appreciate it!

The person that does the #9PMRoutine reminder is sick. No, he hasn't been sacked, but he has been told to hit the sack. Still, we thought a reminder was necessary. So leave the valuables in your unlocked car, open your garage and leave your lights off! Or something like that...

Going out tonight? So are we. Frisco PD will be participating in a multi-agency DWI Task Force from Dec 23 through Jan 1. During this No Refusal period, extra officers will be on duty during peak times, focusing on areas known for a significant number of intoxicated drivers.

RRRRRRRRRIIIIIIIIIIIIINNNNNNNNNNNNGGGGGGGGGGGGGG!!!!!!!! Remove the valuables and guns from your car and lock it up! Then make sure your garage is closed and turn on your outside lights! It's a Wonderful #9PMRoutine! Your Community, Your Commitment #YC2
The Administrative Offices of the Frisco Police Department will be closed December 24th and 25th. As always, our officers are on shift around the clock, so call us if you need us.

Last night, Texas lost another member of its Blue family. San Jacinto Sheriff’s Office Deputy Brian Pfluger was killed in a crash while responding to a call. Sending love, prayers, and support to our Brothers and Sisters there.

Leave this in your car? To burglars, it might look like a Major Award from Italy. Do the #9PMRoutine and remove the temptation. Get the valuables and guns out of your car and lock it up. Then close your garage and turn on your outside lights! Your Community, Your Commitment #YC2
Slow down, increase the distance between you and the car in front of you, and do NOT use your high beams. Drive safely and stay weather aware!

Once again, and much too soon, we find ourselves banding our badges. @SAISD PD Det. Cliff Martinez, a 28 year veteran, was intentionally struck and killed by a vehicle this morning. While our hearts are heavy, our support is unflagging for our Brothers and Sisters in Blue.

While you’re out shopping today, remember that car burglars are out “shopping” too. LOCK your car... TAKE your keys... HIDE your belongings. If you see suspicious activity, call us! Crime prevention is everyone’s responsibility. #LockItorLoseIt

There are five different ways to contact us. **Our social media sites should NOT be used to report crimes or request a police response.** 9-1-1 (emergency) Text 9-1-1 (emergency, if you can’t call) 972-292-6010 (non-emergency) Tip411 (text info to 847411) Mobile App

Sgt. Andrade and Ofc. Carey completed the #PoliceUnityTour today, ending at the National Police Memorial in DC. Not only did they represent our PD well, but more importantly, they honored and supported the friends and loved ones of the Fallen.

In 1962, President John F. Kennedy signed a proclamation which designated May 15 as Peace Officers Memorial Day and the week in which that date falls as Police Week. This week, we join with our Brothers and Sisters to honor the Fallen and Survivors. #PoliceWeek2019 #NeverForget
Headed to DC this morning. The names of the Fallen are read at stops along the way, and we are there to support our Brothers and Sisters as each word is read. #PoliceUnityTour

La Valencia UPDATE: The La Valencia apartments are now clear to enter. Thank you all for your patience and your support.
Update: all major roadways are now open, residents can now drive into the complex and park with the exception of a few blocked areas, bldg 4 is still not open.

Thank you all so much for the support. It is truly appreciated. As of now, all but bldg 4 is open to residents going home in the complex. We are there to help. TxDPS Rangers are investigating and all requests should go to them. If there is another update we will let you know.

UPDATE: For residents of La Valencia, Officers are on scene helping you get back to your home. Please park at another location and walk into the complex as it is still a crime scene. All but building 4 is open to return. Eastbound Lebanon still closed. Thank you for your support!
For those who have been patiently waiting to return to their homes, Officers are still on scene and will give you direction. Not all areas are open as of now due to the active crime scene.
Suspect in Custody. Still an active crime scene, thank you for your support. More information coming.
Thank you all for your continued patience. We will have detailed information coming to you soon. This is still an active investigation with many agencies involved.
Media partners, Unless circumstances dictate otherwise, the update at 6:00a will be via social media. We sincerely appreciate your assistance in helping to keep the public informed.

No updated information to pass along. Law enforcement at the scene continue to work together to resolve this situation involving the barricaded subject. Residents of the complex are reminded to stay indoors, or avoid the area if not at home. Next update at 6:00a.
No new developments as of this time. Eastbound Lebanon between Frisco Green and Dallas Parkway remains closed. Information will be provided on our social media as it becomes available.

No changes to report at this time. As this continues to be a very fluid situation, affected residents are reminded to stay inside or avoid the area. Your cooperation and patience are very much appreciated, and allow the officers on scene to effectively work toward a resolution.

The situation remains unchanged, with officers working diligently to resolve this peacefully. Our thoughts continue to be with the recovering Trooper and those at the scene. Media staging area is relocating to the Frisco Police Department at 7200 Stonebrook Parkway.

Multiple agencies continue to collaborate in an effort to bring this barricaded person incident to a peaceful conclusion. Again, the patience and concern shown by our residents is appreciated. For the most up-to-date and accurate information, continue to follow our social media.

Update: The current situation is being handled as a barricaded person. Unless otherwise directed, persons in the affected area should remain indoors. More information will be provided as it becomes available.

There has been no change to this ongoing incident. Our goal is to provide timely updates, providing as much information as we can with each post. Reminder that eastbound Lebanon from Frisco Green remains closed. Continue to monitor our social media for updated information.

Multiple agencies remain on scene, coordinating efforts to resolve this active situation. Affected residents are urged to remain inside or avoid the area. Frisco PD is thankful for the continued patience of our community. Twitter remains the main source of updated information.

Southbound Dallas Parkway, south of Lebanon, has reopened. However, motorists and residents are still urged to avoid the area if possible, as this remains an active scene. Continue to monitor this feed for updates.

Per Texas DPS, the Trooper was listed in stable condition before going into surgery. This is still an active scene and residents in the area are urged to stay inside. Frisco PD appreciates the efforts of all agencies involved, as well as the continued support of the community.

Statement from Texas DPS. We appreciate the continued community support for all of the officers at the scene, and our thoughts are with the Trooper involved. More information will be released as it becomes available; continue to monitor this feed for updates.
Lockout @Starwood Montessori will be lifted shortly, parents may use westbound Lebanon from Dallas Parkway to access the pickup line.
In addition to the closure of eastbound Lebanon from Starwood to Dallas Parkway, southbound Dallas Parkway is closed south of Lebanon. Please continue to monitor our Twitter for information updates.
Media staging area established in the parking lot of Scottish Rite Hospital, 5700 Dallas Parkway in Frisco.
Active situation in the 6800-block on Lebanon Road, stay clear of the area. Eastbound Lebanon currently shut down. Information will be posted here as it becomes available.

The law only specifies that vehicles are required to yield to the right when approached from behind by an emergency vehicle. In Frisco, all fire apparatus are equipped with Opticoms. These devices should change the light, allowing you to make your turn and pull to the right.

REMINDER - The state's Move Over/Slow Down law requires motorists to move over or slow down when certain vehicles – including police, fire, EMS, Texas Department of Transportation vehicles and tow trucks – are stopped on the side of the road with emergency lights activated.
